Items.Title: Roll Call
Invocation
Items.AgendaNote:
INVOCATION - Delivered by: Pastor Gabriella Cudjoe Wilkes, spiritual leader at Double Love Experience, located at  334 South Fifth Street, Brooklyn, New York 11211.  

Motion to spread the Invocation in full upon the record by Council Member Reynoso.
Items.MinutesNote:
The Invocation was delivered by Pastor Gabriella Cudjoe Wilkes, spiritual leader at Double Love Experience, located at  334 South Fifth Street, Brooklyn, New York 11211.  

Council Member Reynoso moved to spread the Invocation in full upon the Record.

Items.Title: INTRODUCTION AND READING OF BILLS

Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Health
Items.MatterName: Annual reporting of heat vulnerability and heat-related deaths.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon Congress to pass and the President to sign H.R. 6496, the Emergency Money for the People Act, which would provide for the issuance of emergency monthly payments to every American throughout the duration of the coronavirus crisis.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Civil Service and Labor
Items.MatterName: Emergency Money for the People Act (H.R. 6496)

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to outreach to building owners regarding making energy efficiency improvements
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Environmental Protection
Items.MatterName: Outreach to building owners regarding making energy efficiency improvements.

Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Environmental Protection
Items.MatterName: Rent regulated accommodations.

Items.MinutesNote: The Public Advocate (Mr. Williams) presiding as the Acting President Pro Tempore

The presence of a quorum was announced by The Public Advocate (Mr. Williams).

There were 50 Council Members marked present for this remote Stated Meeting.

     At the time of this Stated Meeting, there was one vacant seat on the Council in the 37th District (Brooklyn) pending the swearing-in of the certified winner of the November 3, 2020 General Election.

Items.MinutesNote: At this point the Speaker (Council Member Johnson) made the following annoucements:
Whereupon on motion of the Speaker (Council Member Johnson), this Stated Meeting was recessed subject to call.
The Public Advocate (Mr. Williams)  put the question whether the Council would agree with and adopt such reports, which were decided in the affirmative by the following vote:

The following files were removed from the General Order Calendar and voted separately:

Int. No. 1836-A, 46-4-0 - Negative: CMs Borelli, Holden, Yeger, and the Minority Leader (Council Member Matteo)  
                                              
Int. No. 1956-A, 39-11-0 - Negative: CMs Borelli, Cohen, Deutsch, Gjonaj, Grodenchik, Holden, Perkins, Ulrich, Vallone, Yeger, and the Minority Leader (Council Member Matteo) 

L.U. Nos. 661 & 662 & Res. No. 1333, 48-2-0 - Negative: CMs Barron and Perkins.

See files for individual votes.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the New York city charter and the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to prohibiting the use of the word “alien” and removing such words in local laws, rules and other documents and materials
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Introduction be Approved by Council approved by Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Prohibiting the use of the word “alien” and removing such words in local laws, rules and other documents and materials.

Items.Title: Resolution calling for the salaries of New York City emergency medical service personnel to be comparable to New York City’s firefighters and police officers.
Items.AgendaNote: Amended and Adopted by the Committee on Fire and Emergency Management
Items.MinutesNote:
Pursuant to Rule 8.50 of the Council, the Public Advocate (Mr. Williams) called for a voice vote.  Hearing no objections, the Public Advocate (Mr. Williams) declared the Resolution to be adopted.


Adopted unanimously by the Council by voice-vote.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by voice vote.
Items.MatterName: Salaries of NYC emergency medical service personnel to be comparable to NYC’s firefighters and police officers.
